titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the S. Coates papers, 1871
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Diary kept by S. Coates of Narragansett Pier, Rhode Island, the apparently affluent wife of Harry Coates. They traveled to Georgia; Florida; Yonkers, New York; as well as Philadelphia and Point Pleasant, Pennsylvania. The volume also contains descriptions of her active social life in Rhode Island; at the end are a few cash accounts and a list of names and addresses.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: S. Coates Papers, 1871, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Diary kept by S. Coates of Narragansett Pier, Rhode Island, the apparently affluent wife of Harry Coates. They traveled to Georgia; Florida; Yonkers, New York; as well as Philadelphia and Point Pleasant, Pennsylvania. The volume also contains descriptions of her active social life in Rhode Island; at the end are a few cash accounts and a list of names and addresses.
